data.question: What are the names of the two Cu(I) cluster-based MOFs discussed?
What method was used for the synthesis of the complex Cu3L3?
What is the yield percentage of Cu3L3 based on Cu2O?
What reaction is JNM-1 used as a catalyst for?
What is the yield range for the palladium-free Sonogashira coupling reactions using JNM-1 as a catalyst?
Can JNM-1 be reused without loss of performance for at least five cycle runs?
Is the synthesis of conjugated single molecular wires using JNM-1 catalyst feasible?
Does the synthesis approach for JNM-1 and JNM-2 involve dynamic covalent chemistry?
Are JNM-1 and JNM-2 stable in the presence of strong bases and acids?
Do JNM-1 and JNM-2 exhibit high porosity?
Is the Cu(I) ion in JNM-1 and JNM-2 prone to fast oxidation when exposed to air?
What is the role of Cu(I) CTUs in JNMs?
What is the significance of combining metal clusters chemistry and COF in MOF fabrication?
data.answer: It allows for the construction of new types of function-led reticular materials with rational design.

data.question: How does the stability of JNM-1 and JNM-2 compare to their Cu(I) clusters?
data.answer: JNM-1 and JNM-2 exhibit superior stability compared to their Cu(I) clusters.

data.question: What is the outcome of the Sonogashira cross-coupling reaction catalyzed by JNM-1?
data.answer: The formation of the coupling product with high efficiency.

data.question: What is the advantage of JNM-1 over Cu3L3 in catalyzing the synthesis of conjugated molecular wires?
data.answer: JNM-1 shows much higher catalytic activities than Cu3L3.

data.question: Can JNM-1 be recycled and reused without loss of catalytic performance?
data.answer: Yes, it can be reused for at least five reaction runs without any loss of performance.

data.question: Is the Cu(I) ion in JNM-1 and JNM-2 stable when exposed to air for over a month?
Does the synthesis of JNM-1 and JNM-2 involve a one-pot reaction approach?
data.answer: Yes, but they can also be synthesized by a stepwise synthetic approach.

data.question: Are JNM-1 and JNM-2 capable of undergoing reversible redox reactions?
